Generate Synthetic Data

Source: vignettes/Generating-Synthetic-Data.Rmd
Generating-Synthetic-Data.Rmd

We provide gen_syn_data to generate synthetic data for CausalGPS package

Usage

Input parameters:

sample_size Number of data samples

seed The seed of Râ€™s random number generator

outcome_sd Standard deviation used to generate the outcome

gps_spec A numerical value (1-7) that indicates the GPS model used to generate synthetic data. See the following section for more details.

cova_spec A numerical value (1-2) to modify the covariates. See the code for more details.

Technical Details for Data Generating Process

We generate six confounders (C1,C2,...,C6)(C_1,C_2,...,C_6), which include a combination of continuous and categorical variables, C1,â€¦,C4âˆ¼N(0,ğˆ4),C5âˆ¼U{âˆ’2,2},C6âˆ¼U(âˆ’3,3),\begin{align*} C_1,\ldots,C_4 \sim N(0,\boldsymbol{I}_4), C_5 \sim U\{-2,2\}, C_6 \sim U(-3,3), \end{align*} and generate WW using six specifications of the generalized propensity score model,

  1. W=9{âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚}+17+N(0,5)W = 9 \{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\} +17 + N(0,5)

  2. W=15{âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚}+22+T(2)W = 15\{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\} + 22 + T(2)

  3. W=9{âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚}+3/2C32+15+N(0,5)W = 9 \{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\} + 3/2 C_3^2 + 15 + N(0,5)

  4. W=49exp({âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚})1+exp({âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚})âˆ’6+N(0,5)W = \frac{49 \exp(\{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\})}{1+ \exp(\{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\})} -6 + N(0,5)

  5. W=421+exp({âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚})âˆ’18+N(0,5)W = \frac{42}{1+ \exp(\{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\})} - 18 + N(0,5)

  6. W=7log({âˆ’0.8+(0.1,0.1,âˆ’0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1)ğ‚})+13+N(0,4)W = 7 \text{log} ( \{-0.8+ (0.1,0.1,-0.1,0.2,0.1,0.1) \boldsymbol{C}\}) + 13 + N(0,4)

We generate YY from an outcome model which is assumed to be a cubical function of WW with additive terms for the confounders and interactions between WW and confounders ğ‚\mathbf{C},

Y|W,ğ‚âˆ¼N{Î¼(W,ğ‚),sd2}Y | W, \mathbf{C} \sim N\{\mu(W, \mathbf{C}),\text{sd}^2\}

Î¼(W,ğ‚)=âˆ’10âˆ’(2,2,3,âˆ’1,2,2)ğ‚âˆ’W(0.1âˆ’0.1C1+0.1C4+0.1C5+0.1C32)+0.132W3\mu(W, \mathbf{C}) = -10 - (2, 2, 3, -1,2,2)\mathbf{C} - W(0.1 - 0.1C_1 + 0.1C_4 + 0.1C_5 + 0.1C_3^2) + 0.13^2W^3
